title: The Last Course
premise: A disgraced food critic, now working as a private chef for the ultra-wealthy, discovers a chilling pattern: each of his recent clients has been murdered shortly after he serves them a specific, forgotten medieval recipe. As he becomes the prime suspect, he must use his unparalleled palate and knowledge of culinary history to track the real killer—a gourmet assassin who communicates through elaborate, deadly meals.
protagonist: Leo Vance, a former celebrated critic with a hyper-sensitive palate and a ruined reputation, now navigating the secretive world of elite private dining.
conflict: Leo must clear his name and stop the killer while trapped within the gilded cages of his clients' estates, deciphering each lethal menu's clue before the next course is served to a new victim.
setting: Present-day, exclusive private estates and Michelin-starred kitchens across Europe's most luxurious enclaves.
tone: Claustrophobic and sumptuous, blending the high-stakes tension of a locked-room mystery with the visceral, sensory detail of culinary art.
